sentence.Network_en: Far from being separate, the mind and body form an indivisible whole.
sentence.Network_cn: 心智与身体绝不是分离的，它们形成了一个不可分割的整体。

sentence.Network_en: For many years the atom was believed to be indivisible.
sentence.Network_cn: 在过去有很多年原子一直被认为是不可分割的.

sentence.Network_en: Republic One and Indivisible. Liberty, Equality, Fraternity, or Death!
sentence.Network_cn: 统一不可分割的共和国, 自由平等博爱或死亡.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from late Latin indivisibilis, from in- 'not' + divisibilis (see divisible)

entry.def: If you say that something is indivisible, you mean that it cannot be divided into different parts.

example.ex: Far from being separate, the mind and body form an indivisible whole.
example.tran: 心智与身体绝不是分离的,它们形成了一个不可分割的整体。

auth_sentence.content: Press freedom, like all liberties, is indivisible.
auth_sentence.res_content: Press freedom, like all liberties, is indivisible.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Press freedom, like all liberties, is indivisible.

auth_sentence.content: Mali is one country, indivisible, he said.
auth_sentence.res_content: Mali is one country, indivisible, he said.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mali is one country, indivisible, he said.

auth_sentence.content: So flat and brown were both land and water they seemed indivisible.
auth_sentence.res_content: So flat and brown were both land and water they seemed indivisible.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: So flat and brown were both land and water they seemed indivisible.

sentences.en: For many years the atom was believed to be indivisible.
sentences.cn: 在过去有很多年原子一直被认为是不可分割的。
